subject: Re: Hi, folks
msgSnippet: ... reform ... particularly Shavian and Quikscript- really only work effectively with a particular accent [snip] !All wrenches welcome. :-) Without discussion,
messageBody:
--- In Read_Alphabet@y..., "Dennis Falk" <quozl1@e...> wrote:
>
>
> On 8/9/2002 at 3:16 PM andy_callaway wrote:
>
> H'lo, Andy...
>
> >I've just joined this group. I've been interested in spelling
reform
> >for a number of years now, and have been looking around at the
> >different alternatives. A couple of years ago, I got interested in
> >Shavian, and some time after that Quikscript.
>
> I'll throw a wrench in here.. ;) Most spelling reform schemes-
particularly Shavian and Quikscript- really only work effectively
with a particular accent
[snip]
!All wrenches welcome. :-) Without discussion, we get nowhere...
>
> >Some of you may know my name. I see a couple of familiar names in
> >here, possible from alt.language.english.spelling.reform. I was
the
> >one who created the Shaw Script font, and the Rosetta phonetic
> >translator.
>
> Andy, you know me from the Shavian group here at Yahoo!...
Ah yes. It's good to be back.
